Cricket teams consist of 11 players, each with specific roles and responsibilities.

Batting Roles:
• Openers: Face new ball, build foundation
• Top Order (1-3): Steady run-scoring
• Middle Order (4-7): Accelerate scoring, build partnerships
• Lower Order (8-11): Quick runs, support main batsmen

Bowling Roles:
• Fast Bowlers: Pace 130+ km/h, intimidate batsmen
• Medium Pacers: Swing and seam movement
• Spin Bowlers: Turn ball off pitch, flight and guile
• All-rounders: Contribute with both bat and ball

Specialist Positions:
• Wicket-keeper: Behind stumps, catches, stumpings
• Captain: Leads team, makes tactical decisions
• Vice-captain: Supports captain, backup leader

Fielding Positions:
• Close catchers: Slips, gully, silly point
• Ring fielders: Point, cover, mid-wicket
• Boundary riders: Long-on, long-off, fine leg

Skills Required:
• Batsmen: Hand-eye coordination, footwork, shot selection
• Bowlers: Accuracy, pace/spin, stamina
• Fielders: Agility, catching, throwing
• Wicket-keeper: Reflexes, glove work, leadership

Modern Specializations:
• Power-play specialists
• Death bowlers
• Pinch hitters
• Finishers
